result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keiron J Harris

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed:  Defendant's Sentencing Memo.

Defendant Keiron J Harris not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeff Schwarz appeared in court on behalf of Ashley Fard for Keiron J Harris.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing.  For reason stated on the record, Attorney Jeff Schwarz requested a new date for Plea/Sentencing hearing. State placed global offer on the record. Case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing. Case remains calendared in Branch 2.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Keiron J Harris not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Fard appeared for Keiron J Harris.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe appeared for State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Keiron J Harris not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keiron J Harris in court, appear by video with attorney Ashley Fard, appear by video.  Defendant Keiron J Harris in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared appear by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judical Notice to cases 19JV250 & 21CF3616 Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Police Officer D.Smith.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40. Defense wants to be heard on bail. Date provided by Br. 40 clerk.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Ashley Fard

Court ordered no contact with Hadija B.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Keiron J Harris in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Keiron J Harris in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
